p: The side effects of antiviral drugs cannot be underestimated during the treatment of COVID-19. The Diagnosis and Treatment Plan of Coronavirus Disease 2019 (Tentative seventh version) recommends the use of lopinavir and/or ritonavir, both of which are protease inhibitors and should not be used in combination with statins or for patients with coronary heart disease [ 41]. Chloroquine can cause cardiac arrhythmias and even cardiac arrest, the most serious adverse reaction [ 42]. For COVID-19 patients, azithromycin and hydroxychloroquine can increase the risk of different arrhythmias, such as prolonged QT intervals, torsade de pointes and sudden cardiac death [ 43]. In addition, Arbidol is associated with an increase in the heart failure rate when used in combination with drugs such as azithromycin and quinolones [ 44]. Interferons may affect the cardiac conduction system, causing cardiac arrhythmia as well as local myocardial ischemia and cardiomyopathy [ 45].
